content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    code_blocks = split(md, "```julia\n")
    code_strings = [replace(block, "\n```" => "") for block in code_blocks[2:end]]]
    return join(code_strings, "\n")
end
```

This function takes a markdown document `md` as input and returns a string containing all the Julia code blocks in the document.

It first splits the markdown by the "```julia\n" string, which identifies the start of a Julia code block. It then removes the ending "\n```" from each block and joins them together with newline characters.
